events.message: Customer submitted an initial claim reporting a car accident on the highway involving a rear-end collision with another vehicle.
Claim was reviewed and categorised as an Auto Accident case based on the vehicle collision details provided by the customer.
An insurance agent was assigned to the claim to manage follow-ups and communication with the customer regarding the car accident.
Customer was sent an acknowledgement message confirming receipt of the auto accident claim and outlining next steps for documentation submission.
Request for necessary documents including police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and witness statements was sent to the customer.
Customer submitted all requested documents to support the insurance claim, including the official accident report and vehicle repair estimates.
Investigation into the auto accident claim began, focusing on verifying the circumstances and assessing the extent of vehicle damage.
Investigation was completed successfully with confirmation that the car accident was caused by another driver and damage estimates validated.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer based on verified vehicle repair costs and policy coverage applicable for the accident.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the handling of the auto accident claim.
Claim was formally approved by the claims department after all verifications and customer agreement were obtained.
Payment for the approved settlement was issued to the customer's designated bank account to cover vehicle repair costs.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after payment was completed and no further issues were reported by the customer.
The claim file was archived in the system for record-keeping purposes following successful resolution and closure of the case.
